reviews.subtitle: 9.2/10 Excellent rating on Booking.com - 12 verified reviews from Rome visitors

data.name: Frigerio
data.comment: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED: We really loved everything about the apartment. From the convenient location with all transport services, there's even a bike path that goes to the Vatican. Very convenient for those who want to visit the center of Rome and to reach the Olympic stadium. New apartment, with all services, very clean. The owner very welcoming and kind.

data.name: Federica
data.comment: We fell in love with this apartment as soon as we entered. Bright, super clean and well furnished. Not to mention Francesco's availability, the owner, who satisfied our every need.

data.name: Alessandra
data.comment: The apartment is new, very clean and equipped with every comfort. It also has a large balcony from which we enjoyed the fresh and crisp evening air. The owner, very nice and helpful, welcomed us personally. The house is located in a very central but quiet position.

data.name: Janaka
data.comment: The best accommodation we have stayed in. Very clean and newly renovated apartment. Quite large apartment. You felt at home immediately. There was everything you needed in the apartment. The landlords were helpful and arrange everything you need. BEST ACCOMMODATION in ROME!

data.name: Motlagh
data.comment: I had a wonderful stay at Roma Caput Mundi Apartment. The location is great! Within just 5 minutes of walking, you can reach the train station. There's also a lovely square nearby with easy access to a pharmacy, ice cream shops, restaurants. The hosts were kind and welcoming—especially Francesco, who was so helpful.

data.name: Fabio
data.comment: Excellent apartment location because quite close to the Appiano Proba Petronia railway station. Very cordial and affable owner in requests. Functional and very clean apartment that definitely exceeded our expectations.

data.name: Roberto
data.comment: Cozy, clean, quiet, well-kept apartment with all the necessary comforts for a perfect stay in Rome.

data.name: Giorgio
data.comment: Cleanliness, spaces and courtesy of the owner. House equipped with everything needed for a comfortable stay.

data.name: Mazzariol
data.comment: Carefully furnished, thorough cleaning, very kind and punctual staff. Really positive experience, we highly recommend it.

data.name: Victoriia
data.comment: Everything was very good, very nice owner

data_security.description: We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information from unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure or destruction. We use SSL encryption and updated security systems.

data_retention.title: 7. Data retention
data_retention.description: We retain your personal information only for the time necessary for the purposes for which it was collected or as required by law. Booking information is retained for a maximum of 5 years for accounting and tax purposes.

intro.title: Our Favorite Trattorias
intro.description: A selection of the best Roman trattorias, from the nearby Mastica to the great classics of the historic center

mastica.name: Mastica
mastica.description: Small modern trattoria offering Italian and Roman cuisine with Mediterranean influence. Also suitable for vegetarians, simple and welcoming atmosphere.

tonino.name: Da Tonino (Bassetti)
tonino.description: Historic intimate and spartan trattoria offering traditional Roman cuisine. Does not accept reservations, better to arrive early. Family atmosphere.

armando.name: Armando al Pantheon
armando.description: Managed by the Gargioli family since 1961, this place with wooden paneling has become an institution of Roman cuisine. Offers two menus.

grappolo.name: Hosteria Grappolo d'Oro
grappolo.description: Recognized by the Michelin Bib Gourmand, uses local and seasonal products. Offers a tasting journey called 'Roman Path'.

alfredo.name: Alfredo alla Scrofa
alfredo.description: Historic restaurant (over 110 years) known for inventing Fettuccine Alfredo. Frequented by celebrities.

quercia.name: Osteria La Quercia
quercia.description: Osteria featured by Slow Food in a quiet square. Offers traditional seasonal dishes with local ingredients.

pigna.name: La Pigna
pigna.description: Restaurant with outdoor tables, Italian and Mediterranean cuisine. Near the basilica of Santa Maria Sopra Minerva.

enzo.name: Enzo al 29
enzo.description: Small family-run trattoria managed by three brothers. Faithful to traditions, there's often a line outside.

teo.name: Trattoria da Teo
teo.description: Fish trattoria with informal atmosphere, perfect for families. Offers outdoor tables and seasonal menu.
